definition: different mouths, same voice/to speak in unison (idiom)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: The resolution was acclaimed with one voice.
sentences.chinese: 决议博得满场异口同声的欢呼。

sentences.english: Everybody spoke in praise of her devotion to the cause of education.
sentences.chinese: 大家异口同声地称赞她献身教育事业的精神。

sentences.english: The teachers praised him with one accord.
sentences.chinese: 老师们异口同声地称赞他。

sentences.english: "The world's scientists have spoken clearly, and with one voice," he said.
sentences.chinese: “全世界的科学家已明确发表意见，异口同声”他说。

sentences.english: crowds in Tehran chorused that Israel had been “destroyed”.
sentences.chinese: 德黑兰也异口同声的认为以色列已被“破坏”。

sentences.english: "I'll buy your donkey, " said the two.
sentences.chinese: “我想要买你的驴子，”两人异口同声说。

sentences.english: The papers all chorused the praise of the president.
sentences.chinese: 各报异口同声地对总统进行颂扬。

sentences.english: The papers all chorused the praises of the President.
sentences.chinese: 异口同声地对总统表示赞扬。

sentences.english: The children agreed that this was a clever plan.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们都异口同声的说这是一个聪明的计划。

definition: to agree by chance (idiom); taking the same action without prior consultation
to look at each other in dismay (idiom)
to act without taking time to think (idiom); to react instantly/to fire from the hip
lively discussion with everybody talking at once
to agree/to go along with/to echo (what sb says)
lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
to lose one's voice/(to cry out) involuntarily
to cry out in alarm or surprise
